name: Mulligan Funding

leaders.bg: University of Oxford (1988-1990), University of the Witwatersrand. Former Commercial Litigation Advocate at the Johannesburg Society of Advocates in South Africa. Co-founded Mulligan Funding with his brother in 2008-2009 during the financial crisis. Has grown the family-owned MCA funder to over $1.7B in total capital deployed with $103M annual revenue in 2025. Led two ABS securitizations totaling $220M. Member of the Innovative Lending Platform Association (ILPA).
hooks: *South African litigation advocate turned MCA CEO

leaders.bg: Appointed COO in September 2022. Previously Sr. Director of Compliance, Operational Risk, Analytics & Technology at Wells Fargo (2015-2021), leading technology innovation, robotic process automation, and reporting. Before Wells Fargo, served as Chief Risk Officer and Head of Collections, Credit Underwriting Operations, and Risk at Hyundai Capital America, where he transformed the risk management philosophy and built the Center of Analytical Excellence.

Joined Mulligan Funding in September 2022. Previously SVP of Customer Success and VP of Strategic Solutions Sales at Windstream, where he built and led successful sales organizations. Reports directly to CEO David Leibowitz and oversees the ISO partner sales teams driving Mulligan's record growth.

news.h: Mulligan Funding Closes $120 Million Second ABS Securitization
news.d: Closed a second asset-backed securitization totaling $120M (expandable to $500M) with a 36-month revolving period, following an inaugural $100M ABS in 2023. Rated by KBRA.

news.h: Mulligan Funding Posts Record December and Best Year Ever
news.d: December 2024 was the best month since inception, capping the company's strongest year. Restructured ISO team to deepen broker partner relationships and drive further growth.

news.h: Mulligan Funding Surpasses $1.7B in Total Capital Deployed
news.d: Cumulative funding milestone reflecting steady growth since the company's founding in 2008, serving SMBs with working capital loans nationwide.

ice: Congrats on the record-breaking 2024 and the $120M ABS close — as you scale toward $500M in securitized capacity, how are you thinking about automating underwriting to keep pace with that volume?
icebreakers: Your $120M ABS closing and record December suggest massive momentum — what's driving the surge in deal flow from your ISO partners?
Surpassing $1.7B in total funding as a family-owned funder is remarkable — how do you maintain underwriting consistency at that scale?
With the ISO team restructure, are you seeing bottlenecks in credit decisioning speed as partner submissions increase?
As more MCA funders pursue ABS deals, how is Mulligan differentiating its underwriting approach to maintain those strong credit metrics?

HyperVerge's proven underwriting automation platform reduces manual review time by 70%, letting your restructured ISO team focus on partner relationships rather than document chasing.

name: QuickBridge

leaders.bg: Cal State Fullerton BA in Business Administration-Marketing (2004) and MBA (2012). Co-founded QuickBridge in 2011 with Jason Osiecki and investors David Gilbert and Brij Patel. Prior to QuickBridge, served as VP of Operations at Alliance Funding Group. Started in small business lending in 2002 as a college junior. Board Treasurer of CSUF Mihaylo College of Business and Economics. Also CEO of Good Funding (est. 2020). Company has funded $1B+ to 25K+ customers.
hooks: *Cal State Fullerton MBA — now Board Treasurer there
*Started in lending as college junior in 2002

leaders.bg: Founder and CEO of National Funding, one of the largest private fintech lenders for SMBs. Over 20 years championing American small business owners. National Funding acquired QuickBridge in October 2018, with both companies operating independently. Combined, the companies have provided $3B+ in financing to small and mid-sized businesses.

Manages day-to-day operations at QuickBridge. Oversees the operational processes that enable rapid funding decisions and same-day disbursements for the company's short-term working capital products up to $500K.

news.h: QuickBridge Surpasses $1 Billion in Total Funding to 25,000 Customers
news.d: QuickBridge reached a major milestone of $1B+ deployed to over 25,000 small business customers since its 2011 founding, with an A+ BBB rating.

news.h: QuickBridge Earns 4.8-Star Trustpilot Rating with 330+ Reviews
news.d: Maintains exceptional customer satisfaction with 4.8-star rating on Trustpilot, positioning as one of the highest-rated alternative lenders nationwide.

news.h: QuickBridge Expands Lending Products to $500K with Line of Credit
news.d: Expanded product suite beyond working capital loans to include small business lines of credit, with funding up to $500K and terms of 4-18 months.

ice: Congrats on crossing $1B in total funding — as QuickBridge scales beyond 25K customers with an expanding product suite, how are you handling the increased underwriting complexity of adding lines of credit?

name: Clearco

leaders.bg: Brown University BA, University of Chicago MBA, Fletcher School of Law & Diplomacy at Tufts (Master's). Over twenty years in finance in New York City, including investment banks Merrill Lynch and Lazard Freres, plus several investment management firms. Extensive background in leveraged credit, liability management, financial restructurings, and asset-based finance. Joined Clearco as advisor in July 2022 before becoming CEO, replacing co-founder Michele Romanow.
hooks: *Brown + UChicago MBA + Tufts Fletcher triple degree

leaders.bg: University of Miami BA in Economics, Psychology, and Political Science. Serial entrepreneur who co-founded BrandsClub in Brazil (2009), growing it to a top-10 most-visited website and $60M revenue within 2 years. Also founded DTC footwear brand Shoes4you and led Miami real estate company Home61. Previously at Antler. Based in Austin, TX.

Co-founded Clearbanc (now Clearco) in 2015. Canadian entrepreneur who appeared as a Dragon on CBC's Dragons' Den. Previously co-founded SnapSaves (acquired by Groupon) and Buytopia. Named to Forbes 30 Under 30. Transitioned from CEO to board role when Andrew Curtis took over leadership.

news.h: Clearco Launches Growth Funding Suite with Cash Advance Product
news.d: Launched the most comprehensive funding suite for ecommerce brands — adding Cash Advance to existing Invoice Funding and Fixed Funding Capacity products, giving founders more control over capital access.

news.h: Clearco Introduces Rolling Funding Capacity Model
news.d: Launched Rolling Funding, a dynamic usage-based capital model where available capacity replenishes automatically as customers make weekly payments, replacing static funding limits.

news.h: Clearco-Funded Brands Outpace Competition by 25 Points During BFCM 2025
news.d: Brands leveraging Clearco's flexible revenue-based funding during Black Friday/Cyber Monday grew 25 percentage points more than brands that did not plan ahead with capital.

ice: The Rolling Funding model is a smart pivot from static limits — as Clearco scales beyond $2.5B deployed to 10K+ ecommerce brands, how are you thinking about automating merchant verification to speed up onboarding?

name: PayPal Working Capital

leaders.t: EVP & GM, Small Business and Financial Services Group
leaders.bg: Leads PayPal's entire small business lending division including Working Capital and Business Loan products. Previously SVP of Intuit's QuickBooks Money Platform. Before Intuit, served as GM and EVP of Consumer Lending and Capital Markets at SoFi. Spent 14 years at Goldman Sachs, rising to Partner co-leading the Structured Finance business. Also previously at Sixth Street Partners. Brought multiple lending businesses under a single umbrella at PayPal.

Tufts University BA in Economics. Appointed PayPal CEO in September 2023. Previously spent nearly 20 years at Intuit, most recently as SVP and GM of the Small Business and Self-Employed Group overseeing QuickBooks and TurboTax. Founded and sold two startups early in career. Under his leadership, PayPal surpassed $30B in global SMB lending and returned to profitable growth with $1.68T TPV in 2024.
hooks: *19 years at Intuit before PayPal CEO

leaders.bg: Oversees PayPal's product strategy across all business lines including lending products. Responsible for the product vision behind Working Capital and Business Loan products that have achieved NPS scores of 76 and 85 respectively, with 90%+ repeat rates.

news.h: PayPal Surpasses $30 Billion in Global Small Business Lending
news.d: Crossed $30B in total loan originations with 1.4M+ loans and cash advances extended to 420K+ business accounts globally since 2013. Working Capital drives 36% increase in merchant PayPal payment volume.

news.h: PayPal Plans PayPal Bank to Deepen Small Business Lending
news.d: Announced plans for PayPal Bank to offer more efficient SMB lending, lowering dependence on third-party bank partners like WebBank and enabling direct loan origination.

news.h: PayPal Merchant Receivables Purchases Jump 33% YoY Through Q3 2025
news.d: Purchased approximately $1.6B in merchant receivables through September 2025, up from $1.2B in the same period in 2024, signaling accelerating lending demand.

name: Square Loans (Block)

leaders.bg: Born in St. Louis, Missouri. Attended Bishop DuBourg High School where he developed early interest in computers and communications. Studied at Missouri University of Science and Technology and New York University (did not finish). Co-founded Twitter in 2006 and Square in 2009. Renamed Square to Block, Inc. in December 2021. Returned as hands-on CEO after departure of CEO Alyssa Henry, launching internal restructuring to eliminate silos and promote AI adoption.

Duke University AB in Economics (1997-2001), London School of Economics (1999-2000), Harvard Business School MBA (2005-2007). Joined Block in January 2019 as CFO, expanded to COO in February 2023. Career began as Morgan Stanley investment banking analyst, then strategic planning at Walt Disney Company. Held multiple roles at Activision Blizzard including CFO of Blizzard Entertainment. Also Director in Fox Network's Business Development Group. Serves on boards of Airbnb and Discord.

news.h: Square Loans Originated $5.7B in Business Loans in 2024
news.d: Maintained position as the largest online business lender with $5.7B in SMB loan originations in 2024. Has underwritten $22B+ in loans globally with aggregate loss rates below 3%.

news.h: Square Financial Services Receives FDIC Approval for Cash App Borrow
news.d: FDIC approved Square Financial Services to originate and service consumer Cash App Borrow loans in-house, expanding beyond business loans. Cash App Borrow saw $9B in originations in 2024.

news.h: Square Loans Reaches $1.7B in Q3 2025 Originations
news.d: Originated $1.7B in Q3 2025, up from $1.59B in Q1 and $1.64B in Q2, showing steady quarterly growth in SMB lending.

name: Shopify Capital

leaders.bg: Born in Montreal, Quebec. Founded a T-shirt company at age 17 while at McGill University. Transferred to Concordia University for BA in Economics. University of Ottawa JD/MBA, where he founded the JD/MBA Student Society and Canadian MBA Oath. Became one of the first Shopify merchants in 2009. Appointed President in September 2020. Oversees Shopify's merchant-facing operations including Shopify Capital which has deployed $5.1B+ to merchants.

Born in Koblenz, Germany. Dropped out of school after 10th grade to enter a programming apprenticeship at Carl-Benz-School Koblenz, then worked at Siemens at age 17. Moved to Canada in 2002. Co-founded Snowdevil (online snowboard shop) in 2004, which evolved into Shopify in 2006. Self-taught programmer who built Shopify's original platform. Company now powers millions of merchants globally with Shopify Capital deploying $4.2B in MCAs and loans in 2025 alone.
hooks: *German high school dropout turned billionaire CEO

leaders.bg: CFO at Shopify Inc., leading financial strategy, capital allocation, and investor relations. Oversees the financial operations supporting Shopify Capital's rapid growth to $4.2B in annual MCAs and business loans in 2025, with $1.6B held on balance sheet as of mid-2025.

news.h: Shopify Capital Finishes 2025 with $4.2B in MCAs and Business Loans
news.d: Full-year 2025 originations reached $4.2B in merchant cash advances and business loans, significantly exceeding the estimated $3B from 2024 and cementing Shopify as a major embedded lender.

news.h: Shopify Capital Expands to Germany and the Netherlands
news.d: Launched Shopify Capital services in Germany and the Netherlands, marking the company's first expansion of lending products into European markets.

news.h: Shopify Capital Reaches $1B in Q2 2025 Originations
news.d: Purchased $1B in business loans and MCAs in Q2 2025, bringing first-half total to $1.8B. Held $1.6B on balance sheet as of June 30, 2025.

name: Amazon Lending

leaders.t: Director & GM, WW B2B Payments and Lending
leaders.bg: Director and General Manager of Amazon's Worldwide B2B Payments and Lending arm. Oversees the Amazon Lending program which connects sellers with capital through both Amazon's on-balance-sheet loans and a growing ecosystem of third-party financing providers including Parafin, Lendistry, SellersFi, Intuit QuickBooks Capital, and Slope. Has expanded the program to offer funds from $500 to $10M with instant approval for eligible sellers.

PhD from University of Heidelberg, where he worked on discovering the Higgs boson particle at CERN using machine learning. All three Parafin co-founders came from Robinhood, where Sahill served as Engineering Head of Machine Learning. Founded Parafin to power embedded capital for platforms. Parafin provides the merchant cash advance program for Amazon sellers, launched in November 2022.

news.h: Slope Announces Capital Lending Partnership with Amazon, Backed by Sam Altman and JPMorgan
news.d: AI-native lending platform Slope, backed by Sam Altman and JPMorgan, launched a new partnership with Amazon to provide lines of credit to eligible US sellers. Applications grew 300% week-over-week during the trial period.

news.h: Amazon Lending Adds Intuit QuickBooks Capital as Third-Party Provider
news.d: Intuit QuickBooks Capital joined Amazon Lending as a financing provider, announced at Amazon Accelerate conference, expanding the multi-provider lending marketplace.

news.h: Amazon Expands Lending Ecosystem with SellersFi Credit Lines Up to $10M
news.d: SellersFi announced a financing solution with Amazon Lending offering credit lines up to $10M to e-commerce sellers, the largest individual credit facility in the program.

leaders.bg: Unique Funding Solutions was founded in 2016 in Brooklyn, New York as a direct MCA funder specializing in B and C paper funding with same-day turnaround. The company has 11-50 employees operating from offices at 1672 E 22nd St, Brooklyn and 71 S Central Ave Ste 200, Valley Stream, NY. UFS is known in the industry for fast approvals and commitment to closing deals, serving industries including automotive repair, beauty salons, medical practices, construction, retail, and real estate. Leadership information is not publicly disclosed.

name: Kabbage (American Express)

leaders.bg: Dickinson College BA in Economics (1986-1990), Villanova University JD Magna Cum Laude. Former intellectual property lawyer at Troutman Sanders LLP. Co-authored three books on IP. CEO of LAVA Group (IP investment bank). VP and General Counsel at Security First Network Bank (world's first Internet bank). Co-founded Kabbage in 2009 during the financial crisis, fascinated by cloud data accessibility for lending. After Amex acquisition, founded Keep Financial (vesting cash compensation platform).

Furman University BA in English Literature. Nearly 15 years in fintech and ecommerce startups before co-founding Kabbage in 2008 with Rob Frohwein and Marc Gorlin. Served as Kabbage COO and President. Previously VP of Strategy at Revolution Money (acquired by American Express). Named to Forbes' Most Powerful Women (2017). Helped grow Kabbage to $2.5B+ in funding raised before the 2020 Amex acquisition.
